http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/exce.doc: This is a library module offering a part of the set of functions defined by Microsoft Excel 2003.

int.doc: Rounds a number down to the nearest integer. Positive numbers are rounded toward zero, negative numbers are rounded away from zero.

roman.doc: Converts an arabic numeral to roman, as text. Only the clasic format is supported (out of all formats Excel requires). M is the largest digit, it represents 1000. Numbers bigger than 2000 will be represented by a sequence of "M". D = 500, C = 100, L = 50, X = 10, V = 5, I = 1.

rounddown.doc: Rounds a number down, toward zero. If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the decim...

sort-numbers.doc: Helper function. Sorts a sequence of numbers or arguments castable to numeric. It first casts all arguments to numeric and then sorts ascending.

odd.doc: Returns number rounded up to the nearest odd integer, away from zero.

cast-as-numeric.doc: Cast the xs:anyAtomicType to a numeric type. If the value is already of a numeric type then nothing is changed. Otherwise the value is casted to the numeric type that is most appropriate.

abs.doc: Compute the abs of a numeric value. The value can also be a string and it will be casted to the appropriate numeric first.

factdouble.doc: Returns the double factorial of a number. Computes the double factorial of n as n(n-2)(n-4)...

try-exact-divide.doc: Function for computing GCD. This function should not be used outside this module. Checks if all integer numbers from a sequence divide exactly to a divident.

mround.doc: Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple. MROUND rounds up, away from zero, if the remainder of dividing number by multiple is greater than or equal to half the value of multiple. MROUND is computed through floor function.

pi.doc: Return the value of PI as decimal with 15 digits.

even.doc: Returns number rounded up to the nearest even integer. Regardless of the sign of number, a value is rounded up when adjusted away from zero.

mod.doc: Returns the remainder after number is divided by divisor. The result has the same sign as divisor.

product-internal.doc: Function for product. This function should not be used outside this module. Multiplies all numbers in the sequence.

is-a-number.doc: Checks if the xs:anyAtomicType argument is actually a numeric type or can be converted to numeric.

quotient.doc: Returns the integer portion of a division.

iterate-all-gcd.doc: Function for computing GCD. This function should not be used outside this module. This function iterates through possible divisors and checks if the sequence divides exactly to any of those. It starts from the minimum value from the sequence and searches downwards.

trunc.doc: Truncates a number to an integer by removing the fractional part of the number.
Truncates a number down to precision. This behaves exactly like rounddown.

gcd.doc: Returns the greatest common divisor GCD of a sequence of integers. The sequence can have one or more positive integers.

product.doc: Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments and returns the product.

power.doc: Returns the result of a number raised to a power. The result is computed through successive multiplications.

min-without-zero.doc: Function for computing GCD. This function should not be used outside this module. It calculates the minimum value from a sequence of positive integers, not taking into account the zero value.

ceiling.doc: Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance. Significance must have the same sign as number. Number and significance must be of a numeric type or castable to numeric. Significance must not be zero.

roundup.doc: Rounds a number up, away from 0 (zero). If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the ...

fact-integer.doc: Function for computing factorial. This function should not be used outside this module. This recursive function computes: number * fact(number-1)

floor.doc: Rounds number down, toward zero, to the nearest multiple of significance. Significance must have the same sign as number.

sign.doc: Determines the sign of a number. Returns 1 if the number is positive, zero (0) if the number is 0, and -1 if the number is negative.

lcm.doc: Returns the least common multiple of integers. LCM for two numbers is computed by multiplying them and dividing with GCD. The function is applied recursively replacing the first two numbers in the sequence with their LCM.

sum.doc: Adds all the numbers in the sequence.

round.doc: Rounds a number to a specified number of digits. If precision is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded to the left of the decimal...

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/exce.doc: This module implements some Excel 2003 statistical functions that cannot be implemented with standard XQuery functions. It uses Zorba specific functions.

stdev.doc: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VAR(numbers) )

stdevpa.doc: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARPA(numbers) )

stdeva.doc: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VARA(numbers) )

stdevp.doc: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARP(numbers) )

subtotal.doc: Moved from math module. Returns a subtotal in a sequence of numbers. The function applied is given by $function_num.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/exce.doc: This is a library module offering a part of the set of statistical functions defined by Microsoft Excel 2003.

count-non-empty.doc: Function for average function. This function should not be used outside this module. It counts all non-empty arguments from the sequence. The string value of every argument is used for checking.

varpa.doc: Calculates variance based on the entire population. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.

count.doc: Counts the number of cells that contain numbers or values castable to numeric.

min.doc: Returns the smallest number in a sequence.

sum-prob.doc: Function for PROB function. This function should not be used outside this module. Computes the sum over a sequence of numbers. Checks if the values are between 0 and 1.

sum-x-y-deviations.doc: Function for SLOPE function. This function should not be used outside this module. It computes the formula: sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y)) where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.

quartile.doc: Returns the quartile of a data set.

add-all-cells.doc: Function for AVERAGEA. This function should not be used outside this module. This function adds all values that are castable to numeric.

average.doc: Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of the arguments. Arguments can be empty values, otherwise must be castable to numeric. If sequence is empty then zero is returned. The sequence can be of any length.

maxa.doc: Returns the largest value in a list of arguments. In this implementation there is no difference between MAX and MAXA.

sum-prob-x.doc: Function for PROB function. This function should not be used outside this module. Checks the prob range and x range if they have the same number of values. Adds all probabilities corresponding to values between range_lower_limit and upper_limit.

averagea.doc: Calculates the average (arithmetic mean) of the values in the sequence of arguments. Arguments can be of any type. The numbers are added, and the sum is divided by the size of entire sequence.

prob.doc: This is the same as above, only that upper_limit is not specified. The probability is computed only for range_lower_limit.
Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.

median.doc: Returns the median of the given numbers. The median is the number in the middle of a set of numbers. Half the numbers have values that are greater than the median, and half the numbers have values that are less than the median.

var.doc: Estimates variance based on a sample. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.

percentile.doc: Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence. If k is not a multiple of 1/(n - 1), PERCENTILE interpolates to determine the value at the k-th percentile. The function is computed by (max-min)*k + min

large.doc: Returns the k-th largest value in a data set. If n is the number of data points in a range, then LARGE(array,1) returns the largest value, and LARGE(array,n) returns the smallest value.

rank.doc: This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.

Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers. The rank of a number is its size relative to other values in a list. (If you were to sort the list, the rank of the number would be its position.) RANK gives duplicate numbers the same rank.

percentrank.doc: Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set. If x does not match one of the values in array, PERCENTRANK interpolates to return the correct percentage rank. The formula is uses: (RANK - 1) / (size - 1) .

slope.doc: Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's. The slope is the vertical distance divided by the horizontal distance between any two points on the line, which is the rate of change along the regression line. It computes the formula: sum((x - average_x...

mina.doc: Returns the smallest value in a list of arguments. In this implementation there is no difference between MAX and MAXA.

sumsq-deviations.doc: Function for VAR, VARA, VARP, VARPA and SLOPE. This function should not be used outside this module. It computes formula sum((x - average_x)^2) for all x in $numbers.

mode.doc: Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence. Arguments must be castable to numeric.

small.doc: This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set. Use this function to return values with a particular relative standing in a data set. If n is the number of data points in array, SMALL(array,1) equals the smallest value, and SMALL(array,n) equals the largest value.

avedev.doc: Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean. The formula is sum(abs(x - average_x))/n, where n is the count of x in the sequence.

counta.doc: Counts the number of values that are not empty. Empty values are the one with string value "".

countblank.doc: Counts the empty values in a sequence. The empty values are the ones with string value "". The value 0 is not counted.

sum-deviations.doc: Function for AVEDEV. This function should not be used outside this module. Computes formula sum(abs(x - average)) for every x in $numbers

max.doc: Returns the largest number in a sequence.

standardize.doc: Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev. The formula is (x - mean) / standard_dev .

vara.doc: Estimates variance based on a sample. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.

varp.doc: Calculates variance based on the entire population. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/exce.doc: This is a library module offering the same set of functions defined by Microsoft Excel, under Text and Data Functions.

lower.doc: Converts all uppercase letters in a text string to lowercase.

char.doc: Returns the character specified by a certain codepoint.

index-of-match.doc: Returns an integer representing the $instance_num position of a substring that matches $pattern within $arg starting from $pos.

mid.doc: Returns a specific number of characters from a text string, starting at the position you specify, based on the number of characters you specify.

dollar.doc: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol. The number of digits to the right of the decimal point is 2.
Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol.

value-except.doc: Returns the values in one sequence that do not appear in the second sequence in an implementation-defined order.

right.doc: Returns the last character in a text string.
Returns the last character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.

concatenate.doc: Joins several text strings into one text string.
Joins two text strings into one text string.

pad-integer-to-length.doc: Returns $toPad appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length, the characters are added before the string.

value-intersect.doc: Returns the intersection of the values in two sequences in an implementation-defined order. It removes duplicates.

replace.doc: Replaces part of a text string, based on the number of characters you specify, with a different text string.

substitute.doc: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string. Every occurrence of old_text in text is changed to new_text.
Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string.

exact.doc: Compares two text strings and returns TRUE if they are exactly the same, FALSE otherwise. EXACT is case-sensitive but ignores formatting differences.

pad-string-to-length.doc: Returns $string appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length.

trim.doc: Removes all spaces from text except for single spaces between words.

tokenize-length.doc: Splits $text in groups of $length characters starting from right to left.

code.doc: Returns a codepoint for the first character in a text string.

reverse-string.doc: Reverses the order of characters in a string.

search.doc: Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string. The search starts at position 1, and it is not case sensitive.

Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string. The search starts at $start_num, and it is not case sensitive.

index-of-match-first.doc: Returns an integer representing the first position of a substring that matches $pattern within $arg.
Returns an integer representing the first position of a substring that matches $pattern using $flags within $arg.

value-union.doc: Returns the union of the values in two sequences in an implementation-defined order. It removes duplicates.

fixed.doc: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.
Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.

value.doc: Converts a text string that represents a number to a number.

find.doc: Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string. The search is case sensitive.

Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string. The search is case sensitive.

left.doc: Returns the first character in a text string.
Returns the first character or characters in $text, based on the number of $num_chars you specify.

len.doc: Returns the number of characters in a text string.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/fetc.doc: This module provides functions to fetch the content of a resource identified by a URI. For example, it fetches the content of file or http resources. In order to retrieve such content, the functions use the URI resolution and URL resolver process as documented at URI Resolvers .

content.doc: Tries to fetch the resource referred to by the given URI. It queries all URI mappers and resolvers with kind EntityData::SOME_CONTENT . The content is assumed to be UTF-8 encoded.
Tries to fetch the resource referred to by the given URI. It queries all URI mappers and resolvers with kind the specified entity kind. The content is assumed to be UTF-8 encoded.
Tries to fetch the resource referred to by the given URI. It queries all URI mappers and resolvers with kind the specified entity kind.

content-binary.doc: Tries to fetch the resource referred to by the given URI and returning it as base64Binary. It queries all URI mappers and resolvers with kind EntityData::SOME_CONTENT .
Tries to fetch the resource referred to by the given URI and returning it as base64Binary. It queries all URI mappers and resolvers with kind the specified entity kind.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/full.doc: This module provides an XQuery API to full-text functions. For general information about Zorba's implementation of the XQuery and XPath Full Text 1.0 specification as well as instructions for building an installing a thesaurus, see the Full Text Thesaurus documentation . Notes on languages To refer ...

is-stop-word-lang-supported.doc: Checks whether the given language is supported for stop words.

tokenizer-properties.doc: Gets properties of the tokenizer for the language returned by ft:current-lang() .
Gets properties of the tokenizer for the given language .

tokenize-node.doc: Tokenizes the given node and all of its descendants.
Tokenizes the given node and all of its decendants.

tokenize-nodes.doc: Tokenizes the set of nodes comprising $includes (and all of its descendants) but excluding $excludes (and all of its descendants), if any.
Tokenizes the set of nodes comprising $includes (and all of its descendants) but excluding $excludes (and all of its descendants), if any.

current-lang.doc: Gets the current language : either the language specified by the declare ft-option using language statement (if any) or the one returned by ft:host-lang() (if none).

is-tokenizer-lang-supported.doc: Checks whether the given language is supported for tokenization.

is-stem-lang-supported.doc: Checks whether the given language is supported for stemming.

is-stop-word.doc: Checks whether the given word is a stop-word.
Checks whether the given word is a stop-word.

thesaurus-lookup.doc: Looks-up the given phrase in the default thesaurus.
Looks-up the given phrase in a thesaurus.
Looks-up the given phrase in the thesaurus specified by the given URI.
Looks-up the given phrase in a thesaurus.
Looks-up the given phrase in a thesaurus.

host-lang.doc: Gets the host's current language . The "host" is the computer on which Zorba is running. The host's current language is obtained as follows: For *nix systems: If setlocale (3) returns non-null, the language corresponding to that locale is used. Else, if the LANG environment variable is set, that lan...

is-thesaurus-lang-supported.doc: Checks whether the given language is supported for look-up using the default thesaurus.
Checks whether the given language is supported for look-up using the thesaurus specified by the given URI.

strip-diacritics.doc: Strips all diacritical marks from all characters.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/http.doc: Introduction This module provides provides simple functions for performing HTTP requests (GET, POST, DELETE etc.), as well as a more flexible general purpose function ( send-request() ). Examples of how to use this module Simple GET Request import module namespace http="http://www.zorba-xquery.com/m...

delete.doc: This function makes an HTTP DELETE request to a given URL.

options.doc: This function makes an HTTP OPTIONS request, which asks the server which operations it supports.

get-binary.doc: This function makes a GET request on a given URL. All returned bodies are forced to be interpreted as binary data, and will be returned as xs:base64Binary items.

post.doc: This function makes an HTTP POST request to a given URL. If the body passed to this function is an element, it will be serialized to XML to be sent to the server, and the Content-Type sent to the server will be "text/xml". Otherwise, the body will be converted to a plain string, and the Content-Type...

This function makes an HTTP POST request to a given URL. If the body passed to this function is an element, it will be serialized according to the $content-type parameter as follows: If $content-type is "text/xml", "application/xml", "text/xml-external-parsed-entity", or "application/xml-external-pa...

head.doc: This function makes an HTTP HEAD request on a given URL.

send-request.doc: This function sends an HTTP request and returns the corresponding response. Its inputs, outputs, and behavior are identical to the EXPath http-client 's send-request() function (except that HTML responses are not tidied into XML - see the note above ). It is provided here for use in Zorba installati...

get-text.doc: This function makes a GET request to a given URL. All returned bodies are forced to be interpreted as plain strings, and will be returned as xs:string items.

set-content-type.doc: This adds a default method attribute to all body elements which don't contain a method attribute.

check-params.doc: Private function used internally by this module. This function checks if the request, href, and bodies parameters are consistent.

get.doc: This function makes a GET request to a given URL.

create-multipart.doc: This function takes an http-schema:multipart element, copies it and adds a @method attribute to all body elements which don't have one.

put.doc: This function makes an HTTP PUT request to a given URL. If the body passed to this function is an element, it will be serialized to XML to be sent to the server, and the Content-Type sent to the server will be "text/xml". Otherwise, the body will be converted to a plain string, and the Content-Type ...

This function makes an HTTP PUT request to a given URL. If the body passed to this function is an element, it will be serialized according to the $content-type parameter as follows: If $content-type is "text/xml", "application/xml", "text/xml-external-parsed-entity", or "application/xml-external-par...

get-node.doc: This function makes a GET request to a given URL. All returned bodies are forced to be interpreted as XML and parsed into elements.

create-body.doc: This function takes an http-schema:body element, copies it, and adds a method attribute to the copy if there is none in the original element.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/imag.doc: This module provides functions to create animated GIF images.

create-animated-gif.doc: Creates an animated GIF image. The resulting animated GIF shows the passed images consecutively. It has the same width and height as the first passed image.

create-morphed-gif.doc: Creates an animated GIF image with morph effect. The resulting animated GIF shows the passed images consecutively with morph effect between the changes. It has the same width and height as the first passed image.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/imag.doc: This module provides function to do the following basic image operations: create empty images compare images compress image convert an image one format to another retrieve with, height, format, and exif information from an image The following image formats are supported: GIF JPEG PNG TIFF BMP The er...

width.doc: Returns the width of the passed image.

format.doc: Returns the format of the passed image.

height.doc: Returns the height of the passed image.

compress.doc: Compresses the passed image. Compressing means lowering the quality and reducing the size.

exif.doc: Reads exif information from an image. This function works for JPEG and TIFF images only. It returns empty sequence if no exif information matching the passed tag is found.

create.doc: Creates an empty image with background color white.

convert-svg.doc: Converts an SVG image to a supported image format.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/imag.doc: Module that provides functions for generating SVG graphs. The module provides two function for generating graphs given in the : DOT language (see http://www.graphviz.org ) or in the XML-based Graph eXchange Language (see http://www.gupro.de/GXL/ ), respectively. Both functions use the Graphviz Visua...

gxl.doc: Layout one ore more graphs given in the GXL language and render them as SVG.

dot.doc: Layout one ore more graphs given in the DOT language and render them as SVG. For example, dot("digraph mygraph { p -> q }", ())

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/imag.doc: This module provides functions to handle image manipulations like resizing, zooming, special effects etc. The errors raised by functions of this module have the namespace http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/image/error (associated with prefix ierr).

stereo.doc: Make two passed images appear as stereo image when viewed with red-blue glasses. Both images should be same but from a slightly different angle for this to work. Both images should have the same size, if not, the size of the left image will be taken.

rotate.doc: Get a new image as rotated copy of a passed source image (rotated by -360 to 360 degrees). The image is enlarged if this is required for containing the rotated image, but never shrunk even if the rotation would make a smaller image possible.

charcoal.doc: Apply a charcoal effect to the image (looks like a charcoal sketch).

zoom.doc: Zoom the passed image by the specified factor while keeping the ratio between width and height. A ratio of less than 1 will make the image smaller. A ratio of less or equal than 0 will not effect the image. Important note: this function does not change the size information stored in the image (e.g. ...

crop.doc: Copy a part of a source image as new image. The copied part is all left of $lower-right-x and above $lower-right-y.

reduce-noise.doc: Reduce noise of an image using a noise peak elemination filter.

solarize.doc: Apply a solarize effect to the image (similar to the effect seen when exposing a photographic film to light during the development process).

transparent.doc: Make all pixels of the specfied color transparent. This works correctly only with image types supporting transparency (e.g GIF or PNG).

resize.doc: Get a copy of the passed image with changed width and height (without zooming the image's content). To change the size of the actual contents of an image, use the zoom function. More in detail: If the new dimensions are greater than the current dimensions the new image will have the passed image in ...

overlay.doc: Overlay $image with $overlay-image at the specfied position. The $operator defines the details of the overlay and can have one of the following values: OverCompositeOp: The result is the union of the two image shapes with the overlay image obscuring image in the region of overlap. InCompositeOp: The...

erase.doc: Set all pixels of the image to the current backround color. In most cases, this will result in all pixels to be set to white.

chop.doc: Copy a part of a source image as new image. The copied part is all right of $upper-left-x and below $upper-left-y.

trim.doc: Trim edges of the image's background color from the image.

oil-paint.doc: Apply an oil paint effect to an image (makes the image look as if it was an oil paint).

zoom-by-height.doc: Zoom the passed image to a given new height while keeping the ratio between width and height. So, the width is scaled accordingly. Important note: this function does not change the size information stored in the image (e.g. basic:width will not show a different value).

gamma.doc: Gamma correct an image. Gamma values less than zero will erase the image.
Gamma correct an image for every color channel seperately. Gamma values less than zero for any color will erase the corresponding color.

add-noise.doc: Add noise to an image. Allowed noise types are: UniformNoise GaussianNoise MultiplicativeGaussianNoise ImpulseNoise LaplaceianNoise PoissonNoise

zoom-by-width.doc: Zoom the passed image to a given new width while keeping the ratio between width and height. So, the height is scaled accordingly. Important note: this function does not change the size information stored in the image (e.g. basic:width will not show a different value).

contrast.doc: Contrast an image (enhances image intensity differences) by a given value.

sub-image.doc: Copy a part of the source image specified by a rectangle. If the passed parameters for the sub-image specify a rectangle that isn't entirely within the source image only the area that lies within the image boundaries will be returned.

implode.doc: Apply an implode effect to an image (a sort of special effect).

swirl.doc: Swirl an image (image pixels are rotated by degree).

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/imag.doc: This module provides a function to extend an image with additional shapes. Fully supported image formats are: GIF JPEG PNG TIFF BMP The errors raised by functions of this module have the namespace http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/image/error (associated with prefix ierr).

paint.doc: Extends the passed image with a sequence of shapes. The shapes are passed as a sequence of elements. The possibilities for shape elements are: line: <img:line> <img:start><img:x>-20</img:x><img:y>-20</img:y></img:start> <img:end><img:x>80</img:x><img:y>80</img:y></img:end> </img:line> polyline: <img...

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/intr.doc: Introspection Module for the Static Context components.

construction-mode.doc: The function returns the static context construction mode of element and document nodes.

statically-known-collations.doc: The function returns a sequence that contains the statically known collations.

statically-known-namespaces.doc: The function returns a list of known statically known namespaces as prefixes (fn, xml, xs, xsi, etc).

in-scope-attribute-declarations.doc: The function return a sequence of QNames identifying declared attributes in the imported schemas.

default-collation.doc: The function returns one of statically known collations that is used by functions and operators for comparing and ordering values of type xs:string or xs:anyURI when no explicit collation is specified.

option.doc: Retrieves the value of an option that is declared in the prolog of the module.

ordering-mode.doc: The function returns the static context ordering mode, which affects the ordering of the result sequences returned by certain expressions.

statically-known-documents.doc: The function returns a sequence that contains the URIs of all statically known documents.

in-scope-element-groups.doc: The function returns a sequence of QNames identifying declared in-scope schema element groups.

in-scope-variables.doc: The function return a sequence of QNames identifying declared variables from the static context.

function-arguments-count.doc: The function returns the number of arguments the given XQuery $function takes.

in-scope-schema-types.doc: The function returns a sequence of QNames identifying in-scope schema types, including all the predefined schema types and all definitions found in imported schemas.

default-function-namespace.doc: The function returns the URI of the default function namespace.

function-annotations.doc: Retrieves the list of annotations declared for the given function.

function-names.doc: The function returns a sequence containing the QNames of all defined functions, which are available to be called from within an expression.

default-order.doc: The function returns the static context component which controls the processing of empty sequences and NaN values as ordering keys in an order by clause in a FLWOR expression.

xpath10-compatibility-mode.doc: The function returns true or false depending on whether rules for compatibility with XPath 1.0 are in effect. XQuery set the value of this component to false.

in-scope-attribute-groups.doc: The function returns a sequence of QNames identifying declared in-scope schema attribute groups.

statically-known-namespace-binding.doc: For any statically know namespace prefix, the bound URI can be retrieved with the statically-known-namespace-bindings() function.

boundary-space-policy.doc: The function returns the static context component which controls the processing of boundary whitespace by direct element constructors.

statically-known-document-type.doc: For the given document, the function returns the static type of its root node.

in-scope-element-declarations.doc: The function return a sequence of QNames identifying declared elements in the imported schemas.

default-collection-type.doc: The function returns the statically known default collection type. This is the type of the sequence of nodes that would result from calling the fn:collection function with no arguments.

copy-namespaces-mode.doc: The function returns the static context components which control the the namespace bindings that are assigned when an existing element node is copied by an element constructor

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/lang.doc: This module provides XSLT 1.0 transformation functionality. For details on XSLT see XSLT 1.0 specification . This module implements the invoking of an XSLT transformation from XQuery described in Michael Kay's proposal . Example: import module namespace xslt = "http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/la...

fact.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the factorial of a number.

varpa.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Calculates variance based on the entire population. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.

int.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Rounds a number down to the nearest integer. Positive numbers are rounded toward zero, negative numbers are rounded away from zero.

roman.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Converts an Arabic numeral to roman, as text. Only the classic format is supported (out of all formats Excel requires). M is the largest digit, it represents 1000. Numbers bigger than 2000 will be represented by a sequence of "M". D = 500, C = 100, L = 50, X = 10, V = 5, ...

rounddown.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Rounds a number down, toward zero. If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded d...

frexp.doc: Returns the argument split as mantissa and exponent. The recombining formula is (mantissa * 2^exponent).

sort-numbers.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Helper function. Sorts a sequence of numbers or arguments castable to numeric. It first casts all arguments to numeric and then sorts ascending.

odd.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns number rounded up to the nearest odd integer, away from zero.

cast-as-numeric.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Cast the xs:anyAtomicType to a numeric type. If the value is already of a numeric type then nothing is changed. Otherwise the value is casted to the numeric type that is most appropriate.

cosh.doc: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x. If the result it too large, INF is returned.

fmod.doc: Function performing the modulo operation between the two arguments.

sum-prob.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for PROB function. This function should not be used outside this module. Computes the sum over a sequence of numbers. Checks if the values are between 0 and 1.

factdouble.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the double factorial of a number. Computes the double factorial of n as n(n-2)(n-4)...

try-exact-divide.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for computing GCD. This function should not be used outside this module. Checks if all integer numbers from a sequence divide exactly to a divider.

sum-x-y-deviations.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for SLOPE function. This function should not be used outside this module. It computes the formula: sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y)) where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.

stdev.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Estimates standard deviation based on a sample. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VAR(numbers) )

quartile.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the quartile of a data set.

mround.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple. MROUND rounds up, away from zero, if the remainder of dividing number by multiple is greater than or equal to half the value of multiple. MROUND is computed through math:floor function.

even.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns number rounded up to the nearest even integer. Regardless of the sign of number, a value is rounded up when adjusted away from zero.

mod.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the remainder after number is divided by divisor. The result has the same sign as divisor.

product-internal.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for product. This function should not be used outside this module. Multiplies all numbers in the sequence.

sumsq.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the sum of the squares of the arguments. It uses the sumproduct function.

sum-prob-x.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for PROB function. This function should not be used outside this module. Checks the prob range and x range if they have the same number of values. Adds all probabilities corresponding to values between range_lower_limit and upper_limit.

is-a-number.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Checks if the xs:anyAtomicType argument is actually a numeric type or can be converted to numeric.

prob.doc: Borrowed from excel module. This is the same as above, only that upper_limit is not specified. The probability is computed only for range_lower_limit.
Borrowed from excel module. Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.

is_nan.doc: Checks if the double value is Not a Number (NaN).

median.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the median of the given numbers. The median is the number in the middle of a set of numbers. Half the numbers have values that are greater than the median, and half the numbers have values that are less than the median.

deg-to-rad.doc: Convert angle from degrees to radians. The parameter is first converted to value range of (-360, 360).

var.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Estimates variance based on a sample. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.

percentile.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence. If k is not a multiple of 1/(n - 1), PERCENTILE interpolates to determine the value at the k-th percentile. The function is computed by (max-min)*k + min

quotient.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the integer portion of a division.

large.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the k-th largest value in a data set. If n is the number of data points in a range, then LARGE(array,1) returns the largest value, and LARGE(array,n) returns the smallest value.

rank.doc: Borrowed from excel module. This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.

Borrowed from excel module. Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers. The rank of a number is its size relative to other values in a list. (If you were to sort the list, the rank of the number would be its position.) RANK gives duplicate numbers the same rank.

iterate-all-gcd.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for computing GCD. This function should not be used outside this module. This function iterates through possible divisors and checks if the sequence divides exactly to any of those. It starts from the minimum value from the sequence and searches downwards.

is_inf.doc: Checks if the double value is positive or negative infinite.

ldexp.doc: Computes a real number from the mantissa and exponent. The formula is (x * 2^i).

slope.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's. The slope is the vertical distance divided by the horizontal distance between any two points on the line, which is the rate of change along the regression line. It computes the...

trunc.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Truncates a number to an integer by removing the fractional part of the number.
Borrowed from excel module. Truncates a number down to precision. This behaves exactly like rounddown.

gcd.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the greatest common divisor GCD of a sequence of integers. The sequence can have one or more positive integers.

sumsq-deviations.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for VAR, VARA, VARP, VARPA and SLOPE. This function should not be used outside this module. It computes formula sum((x - average_x)^2) for all x in $numbers.

product.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments and returns the product.

mode.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence.

modf.doc: Splits a floating-point value into fractional and integer parts. Both the fraction and integer keep the original sign of the value.

min-without-zero.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for computing GCD. This function should not be used outside this module. It calculates the minimum value from a sequence of positive integers, not taking into account the zero value.

small.doc: Borrowed from excel module. This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set. Use this function to return values with a particular relative standing in a data set. If n is the number of data points in array, SMALL(array,1) equals the smallest value, and SMALL(array,n) equals the largest ...

avedev.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean. The formula is sum(abs(x - average_x))/n, where n is the count of x in the sequence.

stdevpa.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARPA(numbers)...

ceiling.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance. Significance must have the same sign as number. Number and significance must be of a numeric type or castable to numeric. Significance must not be zero.

stdeva.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Estimates standard deviation based on a sample. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) ) = sqrt ( VARA(numbers) )

roundup.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Rounds a number up, away from 0 (zero). If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is roun...

stdevp.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments. The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from the average value (the mean). It is computed with formula: sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n ) = sqrt ( VARP(numbers) ...

sum-deviations.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for AVEDEV. This function should not be used outside this module. Computes formula sum(abs(x - average)) for every x in $numbers

sumproduct.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Multiplies the elements on the same position in each sequence and sums up the results.

fact-integer.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Function for computing factorial. This function should not be used outside this module. This recursive function computes: number * fact(number-1)

floor.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Rounds number down, toward zero, to the nearest multiple of significance. Significance must have the same sign as number.

sign.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Determines the sign of a number. Returns 1 if the number is positive, zero (0) if the number is 0, and -1 if the number is negative.

lcm.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the least common multiple of integers. LCM for two numbers is computed by multiplying them and dividing with GCD. The function is applied recursively replacing the first two numbers in the sequence with their LCM.

standardize.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev. The formula is (x - mean) / standard_dev .

subtotal.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns a subtotal in a sequence of numbers. The function applied is given by $function_num.

round.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Rounds a number to a specified number of digits. If precision is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded to the specified number of decimal places. If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded to the nearest integer. If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounde...

vara.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Estimates variance based on a sample. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1). average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the size of sequence, including empty values.

varp.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Calculates variance based on the entire population. The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n. average_x is computed with AVERAGE function. n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.

percentrank.doc: Borrowed from excel module. Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set. If x does not match one of the values in array, PERCENTRANK interpolates to return the correct percentage rank. The formula is uses: (RANK - 1) / (size - 1) .

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/node.doc: This module provides a function (np:node-position) that, given a node, returns positional information about the node in the form of an xs:anyURI item. The module also defines functions that use such positional information to determine: (1) positional relationships between two nodes (e.g. if one is t...

in-same-tree-of.doc: Determines whether two node positions belong to the same tree. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the two nodes belong to the same tree. Otherwise, the result of the fu...

level.doc: Computes the level of a node position in its tree. Note: The root node of a tree is at level one. The result of the function applies to the corresponding node as well, that is, within the snapshot in which the position was computed, the node level is the returned one. The result of the function does...

following-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is following the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node...

sibling-of.doc: Determines whether two node positions are siblings. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node is a sibling of the first. Otherwise, the result of the function ...

preceding-in-document-order-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is preceding in document order the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot ...

node-position.doc: Return a URI item containing positional information for a given node. Within a snapshot, each has a different positional URI. However, different nodes in different snapshots might have the same URI.

is-text.doc: Determines whether a node position corresponds to a text node.

is-element.doc: Determines whether a node position corresponds to an element node.

in-collection.doc: Determines whether a node position belongs to a collection.

is-comment.doc: Determines whether a node position corresponds to a comment node.

is-attribute.doc: Determines whether a node position corresponds to an attribute node.

preceding-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is preceding the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second node...

following-sibling-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a following-sibling of the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, th...

descendant-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a descendant of the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the secon...

ancestor-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is an ancestor of the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second...

in-subtree-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument belongs to the subtree rooted at the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapsho...

following-in-document-order-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is following in document order the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot ...

parent-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is the parent of the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second ...

in-same-collection-of.doc: Determines whether two node positions belong to the same collection. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the two nodes belong to the same collection. Otherwise, the resu...

attribute-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is an attribute of the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the secon...

preceding-sibling-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a preceding-sibling of the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, th...

child-of.doc: Determines whether the node position given as second argument is a child of the node position given as first argument. If the two positions were obtained within the same snapshot S, then the result of the function applies to the corresponding nodes as well, that is, within snapshot S, the second nod...

is-processing-instruction.doc: Determines whether a node position corresponds to an processing-instruction node.

is-document.doc: Determines whether a node position corresponds to a document node.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/node.doc: The module provides functions to compute an immutable and opaque reference for any node and to retrieve nodes given their identifier. The identifiers are immutable, i.e. a node identifier does not change during the node lifetime and cannot be reused for another node after the original node gets dele...

node-by-reference.doc: Returns the node identified by the given node reference. The function returns the empty sequence if the node that is referenced does not exist.

node-reference.doc: Returns an immutable and opaque node reference (with type xs:anyURI) for a given node. The generated identifier is immutable, i.e. a node identifier does not change during the node lifetime and cannot be reused for another node after the original node gets deleted. Identifiers are also unique, in th...

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/node.doc: This module defines a set of function which can be used to determine (1) the relationship between two nodes (e.g. if one is the ancestor if another) and (2) properties of given nodes (e.g. their level in the tree). The same functionality can be achieved with simple XPath expressions. However, please...

level.doc: Computes the level of a given node in the tree. Note: The first level has the number one.

following-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is following the node given as first argument.

preceding-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is preceding the node given as first argument.

following-sibling-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is a following-sibling of the node given as first argument.

descendant-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is a descendant of the node given as first argument.

ancestor-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is an ancestor of the node given as first argument.

parent-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is a parent of the node given as first argument.

least-common-ancestor.doc: Computes the least common ancestor of two given nodes in the tree.

preceding-sibling-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is a preceding-sibling of the node given as first argument.

child-of.doc: Determines whether the node given as second argument is a child of the node given as first argument.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/oaut.doc: This module provides the functions necessary to acquire access to the personal resources of a user through the open standard called OAuth . The application/mashup creator does not need to know the specifics of OAuth to use this module.

normalization.doc: This function normalizes parameters into a single string.

protected-resource.doc: This function allows the client access to the protected resources of the user. This function is provided for convenience.
This function allows the client access to the protected resources of the user.

parameters.doc: Create an OAuth Parameters instance. Instances of OAuth parameters are used to contain value/pair data such as oauth_token and oauth_token_secret . For instance the following code snippet: oauth:parameters("oauth_token", "#") Returns the following XML schema instance:

access-token.doc: This function allows the client to obtain a set of token credentials from the service provider by making an authenticated HTTP request to the Token Request endpoint. This function is provided for convenience.
This function allows the client to obtain a set of token credentials from the service provider by making an authenticated HTTP request to the Token Request endpoint.

request-token.doc: This function allows the client to obtain a set of temporary credentials from the service provider by making an authenticated HTTP request to the Temporary Credential Request endpoint. This function is provided for convenience for request-token#2 . Invoking this function is equivalent to: oauth:requ...

This function allows the client to obtain a set of temporary credentials from the service provider by making an authenticated HTTP request to the Temporary Credential Request endpoint. This function is provided for convenience.
This function allows the client to obtain a set of temporary credentials from the service provider by making an authenticated HTTP request to the Temporary Credential Request endpoint.

signature-base-string.doc: This function constructs the Signature Base String; a consistent, reproducible concatenation of several of the HTTP request elements into a single string.

add-parameter.doc: Adds an OAuth parameter to an OAuth Parameters instance. Instances of OAuth parameters are used to contain value/pair data such as oauth_token and oauth_token_secret . For instance the following code snippet: let $params := oauth:parameters("oauth_token", "#") let $params := oauth:add-parameter($par...

format-request.doc: This function creates the parameters to be given to the http-request function. It parses the response into parameter elements if the response status is 200 (OK).

timestamp.doc: The timestamp is expressed in the number of seconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT.

nonce.doc: This function should return a new UUID every time the function is invoked.

signature.doc: This function generates a signature string which becomes the "oauth_signature" parameter. The service provider verifies the signature as specified for each method.

parse-parameters.doc: This function takes an input string and parses the parameters into parameter elements.

parameter.doc: This function returns the string value of the parameters whose key matches a $string input.

key.doc: This function returns a string key which is the client and temporary credential concatenated with an ampersand.

service-provider.doc: Utility function to build a service provider object. This object contains the information required by the OAuth client to interact with an OAuth service provider. For instance the following expression: let $consumer-key := "#" let $consumer-secret := "#" let $signature-method := "HMAC-SHA1" let $rea...

http-request.doc: This function makes the request, and sends it to the specified url using the specified http request method.

additional-parameters.doc: This function finds the server-specific parameters. The specification states, "Servers MAY specify additional parameters..."

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/oaut.doc: Module that defines the errors raised in Oauth modules.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/proc.doc: This module provides functions to create a native process and return the result (i.e. exit code, result on standard out and error). Example: import module namespace proc = "http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/process"; proc:exec("ls") Potential result: <result xmlns="http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modu...

exec.doc: Executes the specified string command in a separate process. This function does not allow arguments to be passed to the command.
Executes the specified string command in a separate process. Each of the strings in the sequence passed in as the second argument is passed as an argument to the executed command.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/proj.doc: Function library provides functions for generating the XQDoc XML's for a project.

get-filename.doc: Returns the string resulting from replacing the directory-separators (i.e. / ) with '_'

generate-xqdoc-XML.doc: This function generates the XQDoc XML for all the modules found in build/ZorbaManifest.xml

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/rand.doc: This module provides several functions for generating (pseudo-)random numbers and strings.

random-between.doc: This function generates one random number within a given range. The function is nondeterministic. The function is based on r:random-between#3 . Specifically, it returns the value of invoking r:random-betwen($lower, $upper, 1) .
This function generates an arbitrary number of random numbers within a given range. The function is nondeterministic because the sequence is not repeatable.

seeded-random.doc: This function generates an arbitrary number of pseudo-random numbers. The sequence is repeatable by calling the function with the same seed. The function is based on posix function srand() and rand() . Specifically, it invokes srand($seed) and then returns the values returned by invoking rand() $num...

seeded-random-between.doc: This function generates an arbitrary number of pseudo-random numbers within a given range. The sequence is repeatable by calling the function with the same seed and boundaries. The function is based on the function r:seeded-random#2 . Specifically, it's result is repeatable if called with the same a...

random.doc: This function generates one random number. The function is nondeterministic. The function is based on r:random#1 . Specifically, it returns the value of invoking r:random(1) .

This function generates an arbitrary number of random numbers. The function is nondeterministic because the sequence is not repeatable. However, the function is based on posix function srand() and rand() . Specifically, it invokes srand() with some random number based on the current time and then re...

uuid.doc: This function returns a uuid. Note, that the function is not stable, that is, it returns a different UUID everytime the function is invoked.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/refl.doc: This module provides functions to dynamically invoke functions or main modules, respectively. Each of the functions (invoke or eval) come in four variants depending whether the expression being invoked is simple, nondeterministic, updating, or sequential.

eval.doc: The purpose of this function is to (dynamically) execute an XQuery program from inside another XQuery program. The XQuery program that invokes the eval function will be referred to as the "outer" program and the XQuery program that is executed by the eval invocation will be referred to as the "inner...

invoke.doc: The invoke function allows to dynamically call a function given its QName and parameters. It is possible to invoke a function whose name is not known at compilation time -- it can be computed, passed through an external variable, taken from a file, etc. The first parameter must always be a QName ide...

eval-n.doc: See documentation of reflection:eval() except the main module that is to be executed may be nondeterministc.

eval-s.doc: See documentation of reflection:eval() except the main module that is to be executed may be sequential, i.e. may have side-effects.

eval-u.doc: See documentation of reflection:eval() except the main module that is to be executed may be updating, i.e. return a pending update list.

invoke-n.doc: See documentation for reflection:invoke except the function that is to be invoked may be nondeterministic.

invoke-s.doc: See documentation for reflection:invoke except the function that is to be invoked may be sequential, i.e. may have side-effects.

invoke-u.doc: See documentation for reflection:invoke-n except the function that is to be invoked may be updating, i.e. return a pending update list.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/sche.doc: This module provides funtionality to get sample XMLSchema from XML instances and sample XML instances from XMLSchema. Apache XMLBeans library is used to implement inst2xsd and xsd2inst functions. Note: Since this module has a Java library dependency a JVM required to be installed on the system. For ...

inst2xsd.doc: The inst2xsd function takes a set of sample XML instance elements as input and generates a set of sample XMLSchema documents that define the content of the given input. Please consult the official documentation for further information . Example: import module namespace st = "http://www.zorba-xquery....

xsd2inst.doc: The xsd2inst function takes a set of XML Schema elements as input and the local name of the root element and generates a document that represents one sample XML instance of the given input schemas. The local name is searched in schema global element definitions in the order of schemas parameter. Ple...

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/sche.doc: This module provides function that are related to XML Schema support in Zorba.

schema-type.doc: This function returns the name of the type of the item passed as parameter.

is-validated.doc: This function returns true if the given node has need validated, and false otherwise.

validate-in-place.doc: Updating function that validates the document in place. After the updating query is applied the $node will contain the validated content.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/stor.doc: This module defines a set of functions for working with maps. A map is identified by a QName and can be created using the map:create or map:create-transient functions and deleted using the map:delete function, respectively. The lifetime of a transient map is limited by the execution of the current X...

remove.doc: Removes an entry identified by the given key from the map. Note that it is possible to insert entries with empty key attributes. However as the removing the entries is based on the "eq" comparison and as "eq" with an empty sequence always return false, it is not possible to remove these entries.

delete.doc: Destroys the map with the given name.

available-maps.doc: The function returns a sequence of QNames of the maps that are available. The sequence will be empty if there are no maps.

is-transient.doc: The function returns true if the map identified by the given QName is transient, false otherwise.

create-transient.doc: Create a transient map with a given name and a set of type identifiers for each key attribute. Note that the function is variadic and might take an arbitrary number of type identifiers for the key attributes.

keys.doc: Returns the keys of all entries of a map. The keys are returned as sequence of nodes of the form: <key xmlns="http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/store/data-structures/unordered-map"> <attribute value="key1_value"/> <attribute value="key2_value"/> <attribute value="key3_value"/> </key> The following...

size.doc: The number of entries in a map. The following condition always holds: map:size($name) eq fn:count(map:keys($name))

get.doc: Returns the value of the entry with the given key from the map. Note that it is possible to insert entries with empty key attributes. However as the getting the entries is based on the "eq" comparison and as "eq" with an empty sequence always return false, it is not possible to retrieve these entrie...

insert.doc: Inserts a new entry into the map with the given name. Note that the function is variadic and might take an arbitrary number of key attributes. If an entry with the given key already exists in the map, the value sequences of the existing entry and the sequence passed using $value argument are concate...

create.doc: Create a map with a given name and a set of type identifiers for each key attribute. Note that the function is variadic and might take an arbitrary number of type identifiers for the key attributes. Also note that the function is sequential and immediately creates the map in the store.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/stor.doc: This modules defines a set of functions for managing persistent, ordered, and updatable collections. Please refer to our documentation for more information about the lifecycle management and the manipulation of such collections.

delete.doc: The delete function is an updating function that removes the collection with the given expanded QName.

available-collections.doc: The function returns a sequence of QNames of the collections that are available. The sequence will be empty if there are no collections.

is-available-collection.doc: The function returns true if a collection with the given QName is available.

create.doc: The create function is an updating function which creates the collection with the given expanded QName.
The create function is an updating function which creates the collection with the given expanded QName. Moreover, it adds copies of the sequence $content to the new collection.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/stor.doc: This modules provides a set of functions to modify a collection and retrieve the items contained in a particular collection. Please refer to our documentation for more information about the lifecycle management and the manipulation of such collections.

apply-insert-nodes-first.doc: This function does the same as the insert-nodes-first function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the nodes that have been inserted.

apply-insert-after.doc: This function does the same as the insert-after function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the items that have been inserted.

truncate.doc: The truncate function is an updating function that deletes the entire contents of collection.

delete.doc: The delete function is an updating function that deletes zero of more items (nodes and/or json items) from a collection.

insert-after.doc: The insert-after function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given items (nodes and/or json items) into a collection at the position directly following the given target item.

apply-insert-first.doc: This function does the same as the insert-first function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the items that have been inserted.

delete-node-first.doc: The delete-node-first function is an updating function that deletes the first node from a collection.

delete-nodes-first.doc: The delete-nodes-first function is an updating function that deletes the first n nodes from a collection.

delete-nodes-last.doc: The delete-nodes-last function is an updating function that deletes the last n nodes from an ordered collection.

apply-insert-nodes-last.doc: This function does the same as the insert-nodes-last function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the nodes that have been inserted.

insert-nodes-after.doc: The insert-nodes-after function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given nodes into a collection at the position directly following the given target node.

collection.doc: The collection function returns the sequence of nodes and/or json items that belong to the collection identified by the given name.
The collection function returns the sequence of nodes and/or json items that belong to the collection identified by the given name.

insert-before.doc: The insert-before function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given items (nodes or json items) into a collection at the position directly preceding the given target item.

insert-first.doc: The insert-first function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given items (nodes or json items) at the beginning of the collection.

delete-first.doc: The delete-first function is an updating function that deletes the first item from a collection.
The delete-first function is an updating function that deletes the first N items from a collection.

insert-nodes-last.doc: The insert-nodes-last function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given nodes at the end of the collection.

insert-last.doc: The insert-last function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given items (nodes or json items) at the end of the collection.

insert-nodes-first.doc: The insert-nodes-first function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given nodes at the beginning of the collection.

index-of.doc: The index-of function returns the position of the given item (node or json item) within its containing the collection.

delete-last.doc: The delete-last function is an updating function that deletes the last item from a collection.
The delete-last function is an updating function that deletes the last N items from an ordered collection.

apply-insert-nodes-after.doc: This function does the same as the insert-nodes-after function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the nodes that have been inserted.

apply-insert-nodes-before.doc: This function does the same as the insert-nodes-before function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the nodes that have been inserted.

delete-nodes.doc: The delete-nodes function is an updating function that deletes zero of more nodes from a collection.

insert-nodes-before.doc: The insert-nodes-before function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given nodes into a collection at the position directly preceding the given target node.

apply-insert-last.doc: This function does the same as the insert-last function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the items that have been inserted.

apply-insert-before.doc: This function does the same as the insert-before function except it immediately applies the resulting pending updates and returns the items that have been inserted.

collection-name.doc: The collection-name function returns the name of the collection the given item (node or json item) belongs to.

delete-node-last.doc: The delete-node-last function is an updating function that deletes the last node from a collection.

http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/stor.doc: This modules defines a set of functions for managing persistent, ordered, and updatable collections. copy-directory-impl.doc: Copies a source directory recursively to a destination path/URI.

send-request.doc: Function for convenience. Calling this function is equivalent to calling http:send-request($request, (), ())
Function for convenience. Calling this function is equivalent to calling http:send-request($request, $href, ())

This function sends an HTTP request and returns the corresponding response. This function is declared as sequential (see XQuery Scripting). Sequential functions are allowed to have side effects. The variables serves as documentation for the errors but can also be used in the code. For example, one useful scenario is to compare an error caught in the catch clause of a try-catch ex...

http://www.jsoniq.org/functions.doc: This module provides the functions defined by the JSONiq specification, sections 1.7 (Functions) and 1.10 (Update Primitives). JSONiq extends the XQuery specification to also deal with JSON data natively. See http://www.jsoniq.org/ for details. This module depends on having the JSONiq feature enable...

parse-json.doc: This function has the same semantics as fn:parse-xml(), except that it parses the string as JSON (not XML), and returns an Object or Array rather than an XML document.

project.doc: Creates an object from the specified pairs of another given object. Specifically, for each name in $names, if the object $o has a pair with that name, then a copy of that pair is included in the new object.

keys.doc: Returns the names used in the object. The names will be returned in an implementation-defined order

size.doc: Returns the size of a JSON Array. The size of an Array is the number of members contained within it.

flatten.doc: Recursively "flatten" a JSON Array, by replacing any arrays with their members. Equivalent to define function jn:flatten($arg as array()) { for $value in jn:values($arg) return if ($value instance of array()) then jn:flatten($value) else $value };

value.doc: Returns the value of a JSON Pair with a given name within a given JSON object. If no such pair exists in the object, returns the empty sequence.

member.doc: Returns the member of an Array at the specified position (starting from 1). If the position is out of bounds of the array, returns the empty sequence.
